biography.value: This creature used to be two separate duergar, a male named Blork and a female named Muatha. Arcturia fused them together into a single creature by using magic that only a wish spell can undo. Both skulls merged into one bulbous head that has three ears, three eyes, two noses, and two mouths. It has a third arm on the right side of its body, and its left leg splits into two at the knee, giving it three feet. The transformation drove the poor creature insane, and it regards all other creatures as threats that must be destroyed.

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.
A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes &Reference[str]{Strength} checks and &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

monsterMunch.titleHTML: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
monsterMunch.fullName: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).

description.value:
As a bonus action, it can make an attack with its javelin. This is in addition to a normal action.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage while enlarged.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage, or [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage while enlarged.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
The duergar magically turns &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its &Reference[concentration]{concentration} is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} with it.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

monsterMunch.titleHTML: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
monsterMunch.fullName: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).

description.value:
Duergar Resilience. The duergar has advantage on saving throws against &Reference[poison]{poison}, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being &Reference[charmed]{charmed} or &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage

description.value:
Deformed. It has advantage on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks, and on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, &Reference[stunned]{stunned}, or knocked &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage
